description: From Middle French prospereus, from Old French prosperer, from Latin prosperō (“I cause to succeed”), from Old Latin pro spere (“according to expectation”), from pro (“for”) + spes (“hope”).

adjectives.description: prosperous (comparative more prosperous, superlative most prosperous)

examples: Trading Babe Ruth was far more prosperous for the Yankees than for the Red Sox.
He was raised in a very prosperous household.
He chose a prosperous lottery number that evening.
